executive_summary: Ethnic supermarkets are retailers that sell culturally diverse food for at-home consumption. The growing Hispanic and Asian populations in the United States heavily influence demand for ethnic ingredients and other products. Younger consumers across ethnic groups represent an increasing customer base for ethnic food retailers. The pandemic led to more consumers buying ethnic products, as many benefited from higher disposable income. Social distancing regulations forced many restaurants to operate at a lower capacity or fully shut down, pushing customers to cook more at home. This led many consumers outside the target demographic to explore different cultural ingredients, boosting sales and profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Growing Ethnic Population Supports Sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Asians and Hispanics are the two fastest-growing populations in the United States. Other ethnicities are becoming increasingly popular, particularly among major metropolitan cities. African cultures, including Ethiopian and West African, have established a market presence. Persian and other Middle Eastern markets are also rising, boosting demand for grocery stores focusing on Middle Eastern products. Growing diversity across the country will continue to boost the need for ethnic stores, supporting long-term industry growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Macroeconomic Trends Boost Demand for Ethnic Products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The 2020 pandemic and social distancing requirements led many customers to cook more at home, pushing many to try new ingredients and cuisines and supporting ethnic stores. As the government lifted pandemic-related restrictions, indoor and outdoor dining regained popularity. This caused more customers to eat out and spend less on ingredients, resulting in falling revenue. Growing food price volatility and falling consumer confidence pushed many consumers to buy food from more affordable grocery stores, causing revenue to fall.

The growing Hispanic population in the United States has pushed traditional supermarkets to increase their ethnic product offerings to reach the growing market. Well-established, traditional grocers can reach better deals with suppliers, offering lower prices and attracting more customers. The Asian population in the United States is also growing quickly, encouraging supermarkets to continue expanding their product range and boosting competition. Some traditional supermarkets have resorted to acquiring ethnic stores to better serve increasingly diverse communities, causing significant drops in the number of ethnic grocers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Grocers Focus on Community and Charity Efforts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Ethnic stores commonly highlight their community involvement, dedication to charity work and overall support to their target communities. Maintaining a positive image with consumers creates a sense of loyalty and encourages returning customers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Some Current Trends Will Continue While Others Get Resolved
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the economy recovers from the pandemic and its aftermath, disposable income and consumer confidence will likely grow, boosting discretionary spending.
Growing competition from traditional grocery stores will continue to threaten smaller grocers by enhancing price competition, preventing significant growth.
The 2020 pandemic led many consumers to try cooking new meals, resulting in a growing appreciation for ethnic ingredients and foods.

industry_definition: Supermarkets in this industry retail food to specific ethnic groups. This includes Asian, Hispanic and other ethnic grocery stores that carry mainly specialty products not found in mainstream supermarkets.

negative_impact_factors: Industry Assistance Level is low - increasing
Barriers To Entry Level is low - increasing

key_trends: The growing immigrant population boosts demand for foreign products. Consumers are inclined to purchase products and ingredients they are familiar with, resulting in more ethnic stores to meet the growing demand.
Younger consumers are more open to trying new foods. The younger generations are more diverse than previous ones, creating a larger customer base for ethnic foods.

Falling consumer confidence prevents ethnic stores from reaching new markets. Consumers are wary of trying new products during uncertain times, causing them to lower spending on non-essential products.
Growing disposable income leads to revenue growth.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Higher income consumers have more flexibility to purchase premium and specialty products at ethnic supermarkets.
Higher income consumers have more flexibility to purchase premium and specialty products at ethnic supermarkets.
Higher income consumers have more flexibility to purchase premium and specialty products at ethnic supermarkets.
More likely to purchase a mix of affordable and specialty products from ethnic supermarkets.
More likely to purchase a mix of affordable and specialty products from ethnic supermarkets.

products_and_services.product_description: Other food items include ingredients to make food from scratch.
Offering non-food products increases the convenience of the store.
Both frozen and fresh meat are staples in most meals.
Changes in agricultural prices have caused fruits and vegetables to become more volatile.
Beverages are highly diverse, ranging from juices, coffee and tea to alcoholic drinks.
Many recipes use eggs, milk or cheese as an ingredient.
Many recipes use frozen foods as an ingredient.

tier_2_suppliers: Frozen Food Wholesaling in the US
Egg & Poultry Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Households that make less than $30,000 a year often rely on ethnic stores for specialty products.
Households with an income between $30,000 and $70,000 are more likely to purchase a mix of affordable and specialty products.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Higher Income Consumers Have More Flexibility
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers within this income range benefit from higher disposable income, enabling them to cover premium prices for preferred products.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region has the highest percentage of ethnic supermarket establishments.
The Southeast region has a high percentage of ethnic supermarket establishments.
The West region has a lower percentage of ethnic supermarket establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Retailers aren't able to participate in activities that will reduce competition.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition within the industry is limited, as product offerings vary greatly based on the store's demographic.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Geographic Limitations Prevent Supermarkets from Expanding
concentration_points.concentration_description: By having various smaller stores, retailers can spread out and reach a broader audience.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Expenses Grow as Food Prices Soar
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Growing inflation at an international level has pushed purchase costs higher.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Developing a niche can significantly increase sales and give an operator an edge over the competition.

FAQs.question: Do your company's advertising campaigns target a wide range of consumers?
FAQs.answer: Promotional offerings and exposure to consumers can increase brand loyalty and frequency of sales.
